description: Ambiguous Promotional Traffic - Low Confidence Demo
scenario: ML model uncertain (moderate metrics) but agents investigate to determine if promotional traffic spike OR service inefficiency

ground_truth.why_edge_case: Ambiguous metrics - moderate across the board (CPU 65%, Memory 72%, Response 450ms). Could be normal promotional load OR service issue. Model uncertain. Agents must investigate context to differentiate.

ml_model_view.reasoning: Mixed signals: Elevated CPU (65%), memory (72%), response time (450ms), error rate (6%). But promotional event expected. Uncertain if metrics proportional to 2.5x traffic or if service degraded.
ml_model_view.would_do: Low confidence - escalate to on-call team for human review. Cannot determine if promotional traffic is handled normally or if service is struggling.

agent_investigation.root_cause: Recommendation service v3.1.0 has performance regression - inefficient under promotional load
key_insights: Traffic is 2.5x baseline (650 RPS) - promotional spike is expected and normal
HOWEVER: Response time 450ms is 3x higher than it should be for 2.5x traffic
Historical baseline: 2x traffic typically yields 250ms response, not 450ms
Recent deployment: recommendation-service-v3.1.0 deployed 3 hours before promo
Promo_recommendations_beta feature flag active - likely inefficient query pattern
Error rate 6% also disproportionate - should be ~2% for this traffic level
CPU and memory elevated beyond expected load profile
agent_investigation.recommendation: CONFIRM ML MODEL with higher confidence: IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED. Rollback recommendation-service-v3.1.0. This is NOT just promotional traffic - service has performance regression. New version cannot handle expected promo load efficiently. Rollback before full promotional period begins.
agent_investigation.escalation_reason: ML model predicted incident with low confidence (68%). Agent deep-dive analysis confirms incident with high confidence (94%) and identifies specific root cause: service performance regression, not just traffic spike. Recommend proceeding with targeted rollback.

roi_estimate.calculation: Without agent analysis: Would emergency scale infrastructure ($35K for 24h promotional period) AND still have degraded performance, losing ~$50K in abandoned carts (estimated 2% conversion loss on $2.5M promo revenue). Agent identified root cause (service regression) enabling targeted rollback. Time saved: 45min vs debugging 'why scaling didn't fix performance'.
roi_estimate.confidence: Medium - cost estimate based on typical promotional revenue ($2.5M/day) and conversion impact studies (1-2% loss per 100ms latency increase)

agent_investigation.outcome: Identified service regression vs normal traffic spike. Prevented prolonged degraded experience during high-value promotional event. Targeted rollback instead of emergency scaling.

ground_truth.hybrid_system_value: ML model correctly identified ambiguity. Agents performed deep context analysis: compared current metrics against historical promotional load patterns, correlated deployment timing, identified disproportionate degradation. Distinguished service problem from expected traffic increase.
